description: a(0),a(1),a(2),... satisfy Sum a(k) binomial(n,k) (k=0..n) = 2^binomial(n,2), for n=0,1,...
comments: Also labeled graphs on n unisolated nodes (inverse binomial transform of A006125).
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..50
R. Tauraso, Edge cover time for regular graphs, JIS 11 (2008) 08.4.4
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^(n-k)*binomial(n, k)*2^binomial(k, 2).E.g.f.: A(x)/exp(x) where A(x) = Sum_{n>=0} 2^C(n,2) x^n/n!. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Oct 21 2011a(n) ~ 2^(n*(n-1)/2). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, May 04 2015
maple: a:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1,      2^binomial(n, 2) - add(a(k)*binomial(n,k), k=0..n-1))    end:seq(a(n), n=0..20);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 26 2012
mathematica: a=Sum[2^Binomial[n,2] x^n/n!,{n,0,20}];Range[0,20]!CoefficientList[Series[ a/Exp[x],{x,0,20}],x]Table[Sum[(-1)^(n-k) * Binomial[n, k] * 2^(k*(k-1)/2),{k,0,n}],{n,0,20}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, May 04 2015 *)
author: _Colin Mallows_
extensions: More terms and additional comments from _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 09 2000
